title: Facebook's libra head: I don't see bitcoin as currency, it's digital gold
text: CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin talks with Facebook's David Marcus, the head of the Libra Project, to discuss the feedback on the social media company's attempt to get into the crypto world and the cryptocurrency market at the New York Times DealBook Conference.

title: Facebook crypto boss: 'I don't think of Bitcoin as a currency'
text: David Marcus, the head of Facebook's cryptocurrency projects, said Bitcoin is more like an investment than a currency.

title: Facebook is being investigated by California for privacy violations
text: The state of California revealed Wednesday it is investigating Facebook over the technology giant's privacy practices, complaining in a court filing that the company has failed to comply with multiple requests for information.

title: Tech Earnings Roundup: AAPL, GOOGL, FB
text: Apple, Facebook and Alphabet reported September quarter results last week.

title: Facebook: We have cooperated extensively with California's probe
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on Facebook's response to California AG saying that the social media company has been dragging its feet in its 18-month-long investigation.

title: California reveals it is investigating Facebook over privacy practices
text: Attorney general Xavier Becerra says Facebook has refused to comply with document requests and continues to ‘drag its feet’

title: Watch head of Facebook's cryptocurrency project Calibra David Marcus speak live
text: He is expected to discuss his involvement leading Facebook's Calibra wallet as well as regulatory scrutiny the project has faced.

title: Facebook accused of failing to cooperate in California privacy probe
text: California Attorney General Xavier Becerra wants Facebook to hand over documents.

title: California has been investigating Facebook for 18 months
text: New court documents filed Wednesday give the first look into the state of California's 18-month-long investigation into Facebook's privacy dealings.

title: California Says Facebook Failed to Comply With Subpoenas
text: The state said Facebook had resisted or ignored dozens of requests for documents and internal correspondence about the company’s handling of personal data.

title: California accuses Facebook of ignoring subpoenas in state’s Cambridge Analytica investigation
text: California’s attorney general Xavier Becerra has accused Facebook of “continuing to drag its feet” by failing to provide documents to the state’s investigation into Facebook and Cambridge Analytica. The attorney general said in a court filing Wednesday that Facebook had provided a “patently deficient” response to two sets of subpoenas for the previously undisclosed investigation […]

title: California AG says Facebook isn't cooperating with probe, asks for court order
text: California State Attorney General Xavier Becerra claims Facebook has failed to comply with the state's subpoenas for more information in its ongoing privacy investigation.

title: Facebook Controversies Aren't Hurting the Bottom Line
text: Despite the social media platform being challenged on several fronts, Facebook’s financial results are not slowing down.

title: Facebook is a hotbed of impeachment disinformation, researchers say
text: Facebook has become a fertile breeding ground for disinformation about Congress's impeachment inquiry, according to a new report by the civil society group Avaaz.

title: Leaked documents show Facebook leveraged user data to fight rivals and help friends
text: NBC News released almost 7,000 pages of leaked documents showing how Facebook treated user data as a bargaining chip with external app developers.

title: Libra shows Facebook is financially 'tone-deaf,' CNET founder says
text: Libra would put Facebook in the same vein as countries like China that are trying to find an alternative to the dollar, Halsey Minor says.

title: Final Trades: FIS, IYT and more
text: The "Fast Money" traders share their final trades of the day including FIS, IYT and more.

title: Have Privacy Concerns Weighed On Facebook’s Revenues?
text: In the wake of the Cambridge Analytica privacy scandal, GDPR implementation and a series of fines, the consensus opinion about Facebook has been that growth is going to taper off. The management’s guidance of expected weakness due to product changes had further bellowed the fire.

title: 3 'Top Augmented Reality Stocks' to Buy Right Now.
text: These companies are bringing the virtual world of tomorrow much closer to reality today.

title: Facebook executives planned 'switcharoo' on data policy change: court filings
text: Facebook Inc  began cutting off access to user data for app developers from 2012 to squash potential rivals while presenting the move to the general public as a boon for user privacy, according to court documents reviewed by Reuters.

title: WhatsApp now lets users choose who can add them to groups
text:
The new feature will help cut down on spam on the platform and give users more control over their WhatsApp experience.
WhatsApp has announced it is rolling out a new privacy setting starting today that will allow all users to choose who can add them to WhatsApp group chats.

title: UAE may lift ban on WhatsApp calls, head of country's cybersecurity authority says
text: Most voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) services – including Skype, FaceTime and WhatsApp – which enable free voice and video calls via the internet, are illegal in the UAE.

title: Even Facebook’s Libra can’t escape the fintech establishment
text:
Despite Facebook’s reach, IMD professor Howard Yu and research fellow Jialu Shanis break down how its Libra digital currency is no match for legacy financial institutions.
It’s hard to believe regulators can learn faster than entrepreneurs, but they do.
